Pattern Library

The Modern Healthcare pattern library is a guide to our resposnive, digital products. In an effort to optimize our website and workflow, we've refactored our codebase. Our approach to styling is modular, allowing us to quickly define new patterns and iterate over exisiting ones.

Bibliography

  • Using the LESS CSS Preprocessor for Smarter Style Sheets, Dmitry Fadeyev
  • MindBEMding – getting your head ’round BEM syntax, Harry Roberts
  • Atomic Design, Brad Frost
  • RSCSS, Rico Cruz
  • Pure CSS, Yahoo Inc.
  • Pattern Library, Mailchimp
  • Styleguide, Yelp
  • Entypo, Daniel Bruce

Typography

  • Headings
  • Paragraphs
  • Blockquotes

Headings

A seconday font is used for headings and has a serif font stack: font-family: Cambria, 'Hoefler Text', Utopia, 'Liberation Serif', 'Nimbus Roman No9 L Regular', Times, 'Times New Roman', serif;

Heading 1

32px/40px

Heading 2

24px/32px

Example:

Section Page or Article Title

Pork belly hamburger andouille kevin picanha. Swine biltong pastrami pork picanha hamburger prosciutto. Brisket chuck tri-tip cupim salami. Salami strip steak shank, alcatra brisket hamburger capicola pork chop cupim chicken. Meatloaf turkey hamburger, pancetta rump drumstick andouille.

Short loin cupim sirloin shank porchetta t-bone hamburger tenderloin. Kielbasa ham hock picanha beef andouille, tri-tip shankle chuck turducken short loin spare ribs flank. Short loin beef ribs chicken short ribs landjaeger ham hock shank, tenderloin filet mignon. Strip steak frankfurter bresaola pork chop jerky ham hock landjaeger doner flank. Sausage chuck fatback jowl venison pig leberkas beef ribs brisket chicken. Flank kevin beef pig short ribs tongue spare ribs, jowl capicola.

Subtitle

Tri-tip andouille tongue short ribs prosciutto, shankle beef. Ribeye ham hock cupim fatback. Meatloaf pork loin tri-tip short loin spare ribs venison. Pork loin pork leberkas pork belly frankfurter alcatra ground round picanha rump swine brisket kielbasa ham doner.

Paragraphs

The primary font is used for all paragraph tags and body copy. By default, text uses a sans-serif stack: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;

Example:

Default text

16px/23px

Biltong chuck beef ribs shank venison swine. Pancetta cow corned beef kevin kielbasa bacon salami beef ribs flank tail fatback turkey jerky chicken. Tenderloin chicken picanha andouille sausage cupim brisket chuck. Tenderloin bresaola pastrami drumstick, pork belly sausage ham hock doner chicken shoulder alcatra pig.

Small caption text

10px/15px

Cow picanha flank drumstick prosciutto short ribs boudin pastrami sirloin. Shankle bresaola sirloin pastrami pig kevin sausage pork chop meatball turducken beef ribs flank pork loin tail.

Blockquotes

Bloquotes use the serif font stack and are typically enclosed with “ and ”.

Example:

Pullquote

24px/30px

“Ham hock tail brisket short loin. Venison shankle tongue, pastrami beef alcatra bresaola pork chop. Sirloin ham flank kevin jerky, spare ribs turkey sausage frankfurter jowl. Ball tip ham hock doner biltong. ”

Lists

  • Unordered Lists
  • Ordered Lists

Unordered Lists

Default


<ul>
  <li>uno</li>
  <li>dos</li>
  <li>tres</li>
</ul>

Example:

  • uno
  • dos
  • tres

Dots


<ul class="dot-list">
  <li>un</li>
  <li>deux</li>
  <li>trois</li>
</ul>

Example:

  • un
  • deux
  • trois

Ordered Lists

Default


<ol>
  <li>eins</li>
  <li>zwei</li>
  <li>drei</li>
</ol>

Example:

  1. eins
  2. zwei
  3. drei

Images

Pure CSS's fluid image class serves as our default for image styles.

Markup:


<img class="pure-img" src="http://www.modernhealthcare.com/images/pharmaceuticals.jpg" alt="Pharmaceuticals">

Styles:


.pure-img {
    max-width: 100%;
    height: auto;
    display: block;
}

Example:

Colors

Modern Healthcare's primary colors are blue, red, orange and greys.

@cool-grey is our masthead color, but can also be found as a text color.

@warm-grey is used for eyebrows and/or label-like headings.

@crimson is the red color for our links.

@spice is the CTA (call-to-action) color for our buttons.

@sponsored is the base blue for sponsored content and is the color of any link in a sponsored content components.

@sponsored-tint is the background color for sponsored content components.

@black default text color.

@white default background color.

  • @cool-gray:#424b55
  • @warm-gray:#585555
  • @crimson:#982329
  • @spice:#df6d27
  • @sponsored:#1a3c6b
  • @sponsored-tint:#e8f0f9
  • @black:#000
  • @white:#fff

Icons

We use Entypo as an icon font (relased under the creative commons license).

Markup:


<span class="icon-[name]"></span>

  • "\e62a"

    icon-cog

  • "\e624"

    icon-search

  • "\e604"

    icon-mail

  • "\e67f"

    icon-minus3

  • "\e680"

    icon-plus3

  • "\e622"

    icon-house

  • "\e6b0"

    icon-previous

  • "\e6af"

    icon-next

  • "\e683"

    icon-info

  • "\e617"

    icon-share

Forms

Form components use simple form styles by Pure CSS.

Default


<form class="pure-form">
  

    <legend>Default form login:</legend>
    <input type="email" placeholder="Email">
    <input type="password" placeholder="Password">
    <label>
      <input id="remember" type="checkbox"> Remember me
    </label>
    <button class="pure-button pure-button-primary" type="submit">Login</button>
  </fieldset>
</form>

Example:

Default form login:       

Stacked


<form class="pure-form pure-form-stacked">
  <fieldset>
    <legend>Stacked form login:</legend>
    <label for="email">Email</label>
    <input id="email" type="email" placeholder="Email">
    <label for="password">Password</label>
    <input id="password" type="password" placeholder="Password">
    <label for="state">State</label>
    <select id="state">
      <option>AL</option>
      <option>CA</option>
      <option>IL</option>
    </select>
    <label>
      <input id="remember" type="checkbox"> Remember me
    </label>
    <button class="pure-button pure-button-primary" type="submit">Login</button>
  </fieldset>
</form>

Example:

Stacked form login:

Aligned


<form class="pure-form pure-form-aligned">
  <fieldset>
    <div class="pure-control-group">
      <label for="name">Username</label>
      <input id="name" type="text" placeholder="Username">
    </div>
    <div class="pure-control-group">
      <label for="password">Password</label>
      <input id="password" type="password" placeholder="Password">
    </div>
    <div class="pure-control-group">
      <label for="email">Email Address</label>
      <input id="email" type="email" placeholder="Email Address">
    </div>
    <div class="pure-control-group">
      <label for="foo">Foo</label>
      <input id="foo" type="text" placeholder="Enter something here...">
    </div>
    <div class="pure-controls">
      <label for="opt1" class="pure-radio">
        <input id="opt1" name="options" type="radio"> Option one
      </label>
    </div>
    <div class="pure-controls">
      <label for="opt2" class="pure-radio">
        <input id="opt2" name="options" type="radio"> Option two
      </label>
    <div class="pure-controls">
      <button type="submit" class="pure-button pure-button-primary" style="float:none">Submit</button>
    </div>
  </fieldset>
</form>

Example:

Grid

  • Units
  • Breakpoints

Our grid is composed of 24ths-based units defined in Pure CSS's responsive grid.

Units

Full width:

100%


<div class="pure-g">
  <div class="pure-u-1">
    ...
  <div>
<div>

Container w/ sidebar:

75%

25%


<div class="pure-g">
  <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-3-4">
    ...
  <div>
  <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-1-4">
    ...
  <div>
<div>

Main content area w/ aside (subnav):

33.33%

66.66%


<div class="pure-g">
  <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-1-3">
    ...
  <div>
  <div class="pure-u-1 pure-u-md-2-3">
    ...
  <div>
<div>

Breakpoints

We use the default media queries as breakpoints for our site. Our nav breakout is at ≥ 48em or ≥ 768px.


/* Mixin */
@sm: ~"screen and ( min-width: 35.5em )";
@md: ~"screen and ( min-width: 48em )";
@lg: ~"screen and ( min-width: 64em )";
@xl: ~"screen and ( min-width: 80em )";

/* Media query gte 48em (768px) */
.element {
  font-size: 12px;
  @media @md {
    font-size: 16px;
  }
}
